alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 4:41PM MST until January 13 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches between Thursday morning and Saturday morning. Localized areas above 10,000 feet elevation could see up to two feet of total snowfall. Winds gusting as high as 60 to 70 mph, especially Friday morning into Friday evening. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
